originalText.text: It's a nice and well maintained pool. The crowd is also good and the staff is also working hard to maintain this place like their own. Super clean, open anyone but don't forget to bring your own locks if you don't have one they won't allow you inside. Shower area is also good and a big change room. It's good if you like swimming in daytime till 7pm it's open they close for a 30 min break every 2 hours and one long one hour break.

originalText.text: I went here today with my three kids. It‚Äôs our first time visiting this pool. I would give 5 stars just for the staff being so friendly/helpful and the pool/locker room  area being so clean! I took two stars off because of the weirdos we encountered; I wouldn‚Äôt feel safe going here again, especially alone. I  would also have to agree with one other reviewer about it not being too much for family/kids to play around because a lot of ppl do more laps than anything else and they do laps horizontally and vertically, and you have to keep watching your back or telling your kids to move so they can pass by at which point I felt uncomfortable and left. Would I go back? NO!

Would I go back? NO!

originalText.text: I went two days back to back first for the second session that was from 4pm -7pm and again for the morning session that was from 11am-3pm. Both sessions were fun due to the lack of life guards only one side of the pool was open and it was the 4 foot side which was not bad considering it was still a huge pool .... it was very clean and i appreciated that very much ... the reason i gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because mid way through the second session they pulled everyone out the pool with no excuse to wait for 30 minutes which was wierd. that particular day was not that warm or hot outside so we kind of just sat there freezing for 30 minutes which felt like an hour. So the next time I went back I anticipated them taking us out for the 1st session and it never happened I bought a book and everything and It didn't happen so I'm still kind of confused about that

originalText.text: It's OK here. A little ghetto but it's the Harlem way, I guess.
